## Maps of Kampala Capital City of Uganda and 7 Major Towns

Kampala is the capital city of Uganda; Mbale, Mbarara, Gulu, Lira, Masaka, Kasese and Jinja are major towns in Uganda.

The size of the circle shows population size compared to other town population. Click on the marker to see more information about that town.

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(leaflet)
ug_towns <- data.frame(name = c("Kampala", "Mbale", "Mbarara", "Gulu", "Lira", "Masaka", "Kasese", "Jinja"), 
                        pop = c(1507080, 96189, 195013, 152276, 99059,103829, 101679 ,72931),
                        lat = c(0.3476, 1.0784, -0.60467, 2.77457, 2.2499,-0.33379, 0.18333, 0.43902),
                        lng = c(32.5825, 34.1810, 30.6545, 32.29899,32.89985,31.73409, 30.08333, 33.20317))
townSites <- 
        c("<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kampala'>Kampala Capital City of Uganda </a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mbale'> Mbale in Eastern Uganda</a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mbarara'>Mbarara in Western Uganda </a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulu'> Gulu in Northern Uganda </a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lira,_Uganda'>Lira in Northern Uganda</a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masaka'>Masaka in Southern Uganda</a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kasese'>Kasese in Western Uganda</a>",
"<a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jinja,_Uganda'>Jinja in Eastern Uganda</a>"
)

ug_towns %>%
leaflet() %>%
addTiles() %>%
addCircles(weight = 3, color = "red", radius = sqrt(ug_towns$pop) * 40) %>%
addMarkers(popup=townSites)
```
